    GCIMSDataset class

    GCIMSDataset-class.Rd

    GCIMSDataset is an S4 class to store a dataset

    GCIMSDataset(
  pData,
  base_dir,
  parser = "default",
  scratch_dir = tempfile("GCIMSDataset_tempdir_"),
  keep_intermediate = FALSE,
  on_ram = FALSE
)

GCIMSDataset_fromList(
  samples,
  pData = NULL,
  scratch_dir = tempfile("GCIMSDataset_tempdir_"),
  keep_intermediate = FALSE,
  on_ram = TRUE
)

# S4 method for GCIMSDataset
getSample(object, sample)

# S4 method for GCIMSDataset
getTIS(object)

# S4 method for GCIMSDataset
plotRIC(object, rt_range = NULL, sample = NULL)

# S4 method for GCIMSDataset
pData(object)

# S4 method for GCIMSDataset,ANY
pData(object) <- value

# S4 method for GCIMSDataset
peaks(object)

# S4 method for GCIMSDataset
peaks(object) <- value

    Arguments

    pData

    A data frame with at least the SampleID and FileName columns.

    base_dir

    A directory containing the file names described in pData

    parser

    Either a string "default" or a function that takes a filename and returns a GCIMSSample object

    scratch_dir

    A directory to save intermediate results.

    keep_intermediate

    A logical. Whether to keep or not intermediate files when realizing the GCIMSDataset object

    on_ram

    A logical. If TRUE, samples are kept on RAM. This is faster as long as you have enough memory to keep all samples. If this is TRUE, then scratch_dir and keep_intermediate are ignored.

    samples

    A named list of GCIMSSample objects. names should match pData$SampleID

    object

    A GCIMSDataset object

    sample

    A number or a string with the sample index or name. If NULL, all samples are returned

    rt_range

    The minimum and maximum retention times to extract (length 2 vector)

    value

    The data frame with a peak list

    Value

    A GCIMSDataset object

    A GCIMSDataset object

    The corresponding GCIMSSample

    A matrix with samples in rows and the drift time in columns

    A plot

    Details

    The actual data is not stored in memory, but read/saved from/to files as needed, so the dataset object scales with large number of samples.

    Methods (by generic)

    • getSample(GCIMSDataset): class

    • getTIS(GCIMSDataset): Get Total Ion Spectra matrix

    • plotRIC(GCIMSDataset): Plot Reverse Ion Chromatograms

    Functions

    • GCIMSDataset(): Constructor method

    • GCIMSDataset_fromList(): Constructor method

    • pData(GCIMSDataset): Get the phenotype data

    • pData(object = GCIMSDataset) <- value: Set the phenotype data

    • peaks(GCIMSDataset): Get the peak list

    • peaks(GCIMSDataset) <- value: Set the peak list

    Examples

    # Create a new GCIMSDataset with methods::new()
dummy_obj <- methods::new(
  "GCIMSDataset",
  pData = data.frame(SampleID = character(), filename = character(0)),
  base_dir = tempdir()
)
# Create a new GCIMSDataset with the convenient constructor function:
dummy_obj <-GCIMSDataset(
  pData = data.frame(SampleID = character(), filename = character(0)),
  base_dir = tempdir()
)
# Create a new GCIMSDataset with the convenient constructor function:
sample1 <- GCIMSSample(
  drift_time = 1:2,
  retention_time = 1:3,
  data = matrix(1:6, nrow = 2, ncol = 3)
)
dummy_obj <- GCIMSDataset_fromList(
  pData = data.frame(SampleID = "Sample1", Sex = "female"),
  samples = list(Sample1 = sample1)
)
